intro: Piratinera paraensis, commonly known as the Paraense Piratinera, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough texture, while its flowers are usually pink or red. The plant is adapted to the humid, tropical conditions of the Amazon and plays a role in local ecosystems.
